ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this course for a fellow Yalie. I took this course as an undergraduate and it was one of the best courses I have taken here.
Yes, would definitely recommend. Too bad he's leaving!
Learn how America manages its relations with the world

The course was a review of American diplomacy in the Middle East over the past 60 years or so. It was seminar style. There was a student presentation every week. There were 100-300 pages of reading per week. The course culminated with a simulation and a long research paper. I would 100% recommend this course to another student. Yale should try to get Professor Crocker to come back to Yale permanently.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: A great class. Intellectually stimulating and professionally relevant.
the best part was the final simulation. Really helped us understand decision making.
It was the best class on foreign policy I have ever taken. Anybody planning on working in international affairs should take this course.
